page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: 2 {LIVESTOCK FARMING}_ most farms in the area use some of their land for livestock, either as an intensive enterprise making use of farm buildings _ pigs especially being kept for farrowing and then fattened for bacon, or on land not suitable for cereals _ in the bottom of the valley, or on a few fields to provide a break from cereals. The number of livestock have decreased since they require too much labour and most farmers have gradually converted their farms almost totally to cereals. Dairy and beef cattle are kept. The dairy herds are quite small and this type of enterprise would appear to be in decline. The beef cattle are bought at 12_18 months and fattened for 6 months using silage and barley grown on the farm.
